recipes.app_wordpress::s3_restore: Installs (if necessary) and restores wordpress for the specified vhost
recipes.app_wordpress::deploy: Installs an instance of wordpress for the specified vhost
recipes.app_wordpress::update: Updates the instance of wordpress for the specified vhost to the latest version from wordpress.org
recipes.app_wordpress::enable_continuous_backup: Creates a cron job which will run app_wordpress::s3_backup daily
recipes.app_wordpress::s3_backup: Backs up the content of the wp-content directory for the specified vhost.

app_wordpress/s3_bucket.description: The namne of the S3 bucket for backups.

web_apache/vhost_fqdn.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the new vhost to create.  Example www.apache.org

aws/secret_access_key.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve your access identifiers. Ex: XVdxPgOM4auGcMlPz61IZGotpr9LzzI07tT8s2Ws

aws/access_key_id.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve you access identifiers. Ex: 1JHQQ4KVEVM02KVEVM02

web_apache/vhost_aliases.description: The possible hostname aliases (if any) for the vhost.  For instance to host the same content at www.yourdomain.com and yourdomain.com simply put "yourdomain.com" here.  Many values can be supplied, separated by spaces

app_wordpress/backup_history_to_keep.description: The number of S3 backups to keep as history.

app_wordpress/db_pass.display_name: MySQL Database Password for this Wordpress instance
app_wordpress/db_pass.description: The password to access the MySQL database for this Wordpress instance
